title: U.S. News: U.S. Watch
text:
In Training Accident

Five U.S. Marines died after their military plane crashed in a training accident in Southern California on Wednesday, authorities said.

The cause of the crash, near Glamis, Calif., near the U.S.-Mexico border, wasn't clear. The plane, an MV-22B Osprey manufactured by Boeing Co. and Bell Textron, has been involved in several fatal Marine crashes. Bell Textron said it stood ready to assist the Marines. Boeing didn't return requests for comment.

-- Alyssa Lukpat

---

MARYLAND

Three at Company

Killed by Gunman

A shooting in Smithsburg, Md., has left at least three dead and one critically injured, authorities said.

Police responded to the shooting at about 2:30 p.m. Thursday at Columbia Machine, a manufacturing company, according to local officials.

State police tracked down the suspect, who had fled the scene. Both the shooter and a state trooper were injured and sent for medical treatment, said the Washington County Sheriff's Office.

-- Talal Ansari

---

ECONOMY

Labor Market Shows

Signs of Cooling

New applications for unemployment benefits rose last week above their prepandemic average for the first time since January, adding to signs the hot labor market could be starting to cool a little.

Initial jobless claims, a proxy for layoffs, increased by 27,000 to 229,000 last week from the previous week's revised level of 202,000, the Labor Department said Thursday. Claims had been at or below the 2019 average of 218,000 since late January.

-- Bryan Mena

---

ARKANSAS

At Least Three Dead

In Series of Crashes

At least three people died in crashes Wednesday involving at least a dozen vehicles on Interstate 30 in Arkansas, according to state police.

The chain-reaction crash started with two vehicles and was followed by two more crashes, all which took place within about a quarter-mile span. The crashes involved commercial transport vehicles, sedans and pickup trucks. Heavy rain was a contributing factor for some of the crashes.

-- Allison Prang
